stick.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to attach something to something else using a substance, or to become attached to a surface
stick.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Someone had stuck posters all over the walls.
I could feel my shirt sticking to my back.
The oil keeps the pasta from sticking together.
stick.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it
stick.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The boy stuck his finger up his nose.
pins stuck in a notice board
stick.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to put something somewhere quickly and without much care
stick.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Just stick it in the microwave for a few minutes.
The cards had been stuck through the letterbox.
stick.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if you stick a part of your body somewhere, you put it in a position where other people can see it
stick.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Clara stuck her head around the door to see who was there.
The baby stuck his legs in the air.
Don’t stick your tongue out. It’s rude!
stick.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if something sticks, it becomes fixed in one position and is difficult to move
stick.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The wheels stuck fast (=stuck completely) in the mud.
stick.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if a name that someone has invented sticks, people continue using it
stick.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: One newspaper dubbed him ‘Eddie the Eagle’, and the name stuck.
stick.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to continue to accept a situation or person, even though you do not like them
stick.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: I can’t stick mum’s new boyfriend.
I don’t know how you stick it.
Gerry can’t stick working for Featherstone’s any longer.
stick.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a long thin piece of wood from a tree, which is no longer attached to the tree
stick.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They collected sticks to start the fire.
stick.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
stick.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (=uses a stick to help her walk).
stick.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a long thin or round piece of something
stick.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a long, specially shaped piece of wood, plastic etc that you use in some sports to hit a ball
stick.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: the handle you use to control a plane
